definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: The bath also performs general laboratory applications, such as incubation and sample tempering.
sentences.chinese: 浴槽也可用于如孵育和样品保温等类常规实验。

sentences.english: Objective To establish an effective but simple method for the incubation of precision-cut lung slices.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立一种简便有效的离体肺组织切片孵育方法。

sentences.english: Methods Studying in an in vitro model of rat hippocampal slice.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用离体孵育的大鼠海马脑片制备“缺血”模型。

sentences.english: And Australian scientists have successfully bred seven wobbegong sharks to release into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲科学家成功孵育七只斑纹须鲨，释放海中。

sentences.english: And incubation can not only induce lipid peroxidation but also induce protein oxidation.
sentences.chinese: 孵育可致精子的脂质过氧化损伤和蛋白氧化损伤。

definition: breeding/to incubate/innovation (esp. in commerce and marketing)
incubation period/time for sth to develop
to pass to the next generation
trophoblastic layer (attaches fertilized ovum to the uterus)/trophoderm
